text: Validate is called on a block with 0 transactions inside, a new filter bit array is created with size of 0, and the code that is inside the filter bit array's constructor is: `ba := make(FilterBitArray, (size-1)/byteSize+1)` so I think it's evaluated to a negative number or something.
<@U0ZJZBJLF>  - is this with the current master?
well, actually it's master + a small addition(<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4091/>)  but I don't think I did anything that should effect it:
I can go back to master and see
The failure occurs when you deploy a chaincode, and the code that I added only handles join channel which is before deploying a chaincode
<@U0ZJZBJLF> core/committer/txvalidator/validator.go:89 evaluates to a comment line for me
what’s the recreate steps ?
the line you seek is line 87 in your code.
`txsfltr := ledgerUtil.NewFilterBitArray(uint(len(block.Data.Data)))`
I extracted the `block.Data.Data` to a variable and printed it, to debug the problem (hence the +2 line difference)
recreate steps: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/aea1751fba4e61f9becdf37f9861d5e010491520/docs/channel-setup.md>
in: `Using Vagrant`

text: this happens on transaction submission from node SDK with latest fabric, strange thing is I just need to resubmit the transaction a few more times and it’ll eventually succeed

When creating proposals and setting up the ChaincodeSpec you supply it with a ChaindcodeID.
At the moment I've only ever seen in ChaincodeID the name set.  But it also has a path component.  What does path do ?  What is the use case for setting this ?

Thanks.
<@U2Q0HP4HY> that is the path to the chaincode for deployment purposes
<@U0ZJZBJLF> I can recreate the problem… looking at it
cool. would be happy to know what's the root cause. But it seems `master` is broken for chaincode deployments for now
clearly something has regressed yesterday
<@U0UKTPMG8> So this would be the path in the docker container ?  The Java and Node SDK have never set this as it's I think usually in the PATH
<@U0ULK2JPP> - one of the proto changes?
<@U0PB67X4K> I don’t think so… <@U0ZJZBJLF> ran into that before it got merged (not sure if they are merged actually)
no, not merged yet
Also in ChaincodeSpec there is ConfidentialityLevel  is this ever set to something other than PUBLIC ? Is it use d :slightly_smiling_face:
I ran into it around the time I posted it in this channel, <@U0ULK2JPP>  , <@U0PB67X4K>
thanks to <@U1KDAMDJ7> (and <@U0XPR4NP4>) for helping with debug. To be fixed shortly <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1733>
